Functions
Messaging
Stratify Object Notation

Detailed Description

SON Messaging enables storing object notation objects in RAM as well as sending and receiving the the objects over serial connections like device FIFOs/SPI/UART, etc. The allows objects to be quickly and easily shared between processes or over the network.

Functions

int son_create_message (son_t *h, void *message, int nbyte, son_stack_t *stack, size_t stack_size)

Function Documentation

int son_create_message ( son_t *  h,
void *  message,
int  nbyte,
son_stack_t *  stack,
size_t  stack_size 
)

Creates a memory area where SON objects can be stored.

Parameters
hA pointer to the handle
messageA pointer to the memory message
nbyteThe number of bytes in the memory message
stackThe SON stack
stack_sizeThe number of entries in the SON stack
int son_edit_message ( son_t *  h,
void *  message,
int  nbyte 
)

Opens an message for editing.

Parameters
hA pointer to the handle
messageA pointer to the memory message
nbyteThe number of bytes in the message
int son_get_message_size ( son_t *  h)

Gets the total size of the message in bytes.

Parameters
hA pointer to the SON handle
Returns
The number of bytes in the message or less than zero for an error
int son_open_message ( son_t *  h,
void *  message,
int  nbyte 
)

Opens a memory message for reading.

Parameters
hA pointer to the handle
messageA pointer to the memory message
nbyteThe number of bytes in the memory message
int son_recv_message ( son_t *  h,
int  fd,
int  timeout 
)

Receives on message on the specified file descriptor.

Parameters
hA pointer to the SON handle
fdThe file descriptor to listen to
timeoutThe max milliseconds to block between bytes before aborting
Returns
The number of bytes successfully received in the message or less than zero for an error

If the message does not fit in the handle's memory, the message will be truncated.

int son_send_message ( son_t *  h,
int  fd,
int  timeout 
)

Sends a message on the specified file descriptor.

Parameters
hA pointer to the SON handle
fdThe open file descriptor to write the message to
timeoutThe max milliseconds to block between bytes before aborting
Returns
The number of bytes sent or less than zero for an error

To send a message, the handle should be closed for writing and editing. For example:

1 son_t handle;
2 son_stack_t stack[4];
3 char buffer[256];
4 son_create_message(&handle, buffer, 256, stack, 4);
5 son_open_obj(&handle, ""); //create root as object
6 son_write_str(&handle, "first", "John");
7 son_write_str(&handle, "last", "Doe");
8 son_close(&handle);

//the buffer now contains a complete message and is ready to send
